column4: how to reinstall "apt-get autoremove" packages? (I've deleted half the system)
lol. what's up
i understand, sometimes it's because of the deps of the packages. usually you needn't worry about them
iceroot : I always use it but this time it's different
iceroot : it has deleted totem, empathy, and many other programs :(
why not just get back whatever you what
you've got a point of view but the problem I don't know the libs it deleted, dvds don't work any more :)
apt-get install totem ?
iceroot: should'nt be there a place where it logs what has been deleted?
Segmentation fault :D
iceroot : I've got a huge log would it be beneficial to post it?
iceroot : gedit is deleted, too
iceroot: I said half of the system
grep -n  'autoremove'  /var/log/apt/history.log
and you can see when and where you autoremoved
iceroot: the computer freezed
why
I feel it's because half of the system isn't there
iceroot : can't I undo autoremove?
iceroot: I suspect the problem is I installed netbeans
reinstall ubuntu-desktop should be ok
iceroot : and after installation it said installation didn't go fine, so I tried "apt-get install netbeans" and it said netbeans is the newest version but suggested to autoremove about 270 MB
